DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Finding Pre-study Corrected QT Interval Greater Than or Equal To Integer::450 Millisecond Outcome Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response that indicates the pre-study corrected QTc interval is greater than or equal to 450 ms.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Finding Pre-study Corrected QT Interval Greater Than or Equal To Integer::450 Millisecond Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition._Occurring before enrollment/treatment on-study._The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::450_A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second)._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

Concepts.definition: The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

Property.preferredName: Pre-study Corrected QT Interval Greater Than or Equal To Integer::450 Millisecond Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring before enrollment/treatment on-study.:The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::450:A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is QTc interval greater than
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is QTc interval greater than or equal to 450 ms (ie, grade 1 or higher on EKG prior to initiation of study treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study QTc less than or equal to 450 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study QTc interval greater than or equal to 450 ms (i.e. grade 1 or higher on EKG prior to initiation of study treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study QTcF less than or equal to 450 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is mean pre-study QTc interval greater than or equal to 450 ms (i.e. grade 1 or higher on EKG prior to initiation of study treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is mean resting QTC interval using the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than or equal to 450 ms (ie. Grade 1 or higher) for males and greater than 470 ms for females on ECG prior to initiation of study treatment obtained from 3 electrocardiograms (ECGs) obtained 2-5 minutes apart at study entry, or history of congenital long QT syndrome.  If baseline QTc on screening ECG is greater than or equal to 450 ms for males or greater than 470 ms for females.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is mean resting QTC interval using the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than or equal to 450 ms (ie. Grade 1 or higher) for males and greater than 470 ms for females on ECG prior to initiation of study treatment obtained from 3 electrocardiograms (ECGs) obtained 2-5 minutes apart at study entry, or history of congenital long QT syndrome.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study heart-rate corrected QT (QTc) interval greater than or equal to 450 ms (i.e., grade 1 or higher) on electrocardiogram (ECG) prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prolongation of corrected QT interval (QTcF) of greater than 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study QTcF greater than 450 msec on screening ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prolongation of the heart rate corrected QT (QTc) interval greater than or equal to 450 milliseconds (grade 1 or higher) on the screening electrocardiogram (ECG) prior to the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTc or QTcF interval length less than or equal to 450 msec within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTc interval length less than 450 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a corrected QT interval (QTc) prolongation to greater than 470 ms (females) or greater than 450 ms (males) based on average of the screening triplicate 12-lead ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study QTcF greater than or equal to 450 msec on screening ECG by Fridericia (machine or manual read allowed)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QT interval corrected by Fridericia's formula (QTcF) less than or equal to 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTcF greater than or equal to 450 ms at screening?
